document_data.name: Quill
document_data.mainbody: '''Quills''' were [[specialty priest]]s of the [[Church of Oghma]] who collected and recorded knowledge.<ref name="WaPotR-p100" >
document_data.Activities: Given the amount of time spent recording various forms of knowledge, quills were usually well-versed with the history of their region.
document_data.Culture: Quills prided themselves on their diligence to their duties. They usually possessed an impressive memory and had a pleasing speaking voice.
document_data.Abilities:
Quills usually had all of the items required to write magical clerical [[scroll]]s.

[[Spell]]s from both the [[Combat sphere|combat]] and [[necromantic sphere]]s were denied to a quill, nor could they [[turn undead]].
document_data.Possessions:
Quills dressed similar to [[holy singer]]s with a white [[tunic]] and pants and a black [[gold]]-trimmed vest. Their hat was small and box-like. Many quills also wore a sleeve protector on the forearm of their writing arm to protect their clothes from [[ink]] stains. These were sometimes decorated and served as a badge of office.

They spent very little time with martial training, thus they usually only carried smaller weapons, such as [[dagger]]s. Lighter [[armor]] such as [[leather armor]] could also be worn.
